intro: Murdannia gardneri, commonly known as the African buttercup, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of about 30 centimeters. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with five petals, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Its leaves are heart-shaped and often have a slightly hairy texture. Murdannia gardneri is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and along riverbanks.
